meanings.definition: Not able to be disputed or challenged.
meanings.sent2: Her incontestability argument left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent3: The incontestability fact made everyone laugh at the absurdity of the situation.
meanings.sent4: His incontestability honesty shone through in every word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The incontestability truth was like a bright light in the darkness of uncertainty.

meanings.definition: The quality of being beyond dispute or challenge.
meanings.sent1: The incontestability of her claim was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: He presented evidence to prove the incontestability of his theory.
meanings.sent3: The incontestability of the cake's deliciousness made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The incontestability of her leadership was like a beacon in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The incontestability of his victory echoed through the halls of the competition.
